body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.3.25-4 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-6152/folder/13176706/41236849/1207856089?sort=%2Bidentifier **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester+ccardfeed@applause.expensifail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Regression TC Execution **Device used:** Windows 11 Home/Chrome **App Component:** Workspace Settings ## Action Performed: Preconditions: - Login applausetester+ccardfeed@applause.expensifail.com 1. Open https://staging.new.expensify.com/ 2. Navigate to Navigate to the workspace "Company Cards tests - DO NOT DELETE!" 3. Navigate to Company Cards 4. Open VISA feed 5. Click on Settings 6. Disable Allow deleting transactions 7. Go back to Company Card feed 8. Find *2143 card 9. Open card RHN 10. Click 'View transactions' 11. Select 1 transaction 12. Delete it by using 'x selected' menu 13. Enable Allow deleting transactions 14. Repeat Step 7 - 13 ## Expected Result: User should not able to delete card transactions: At step 12: Verify it cannot be deleted, since deleting transactions is disabled At step 14: Verify it still can’t be deleted since it was imported prior the settings change ## Actual Result: User can delete some card transactions from Reports page. User unable to delete transactions in Workspace chat ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/bfa7753c-6feb-490b-99d2-9ca486737695 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] [Performance] Move search bulk actions logic to a custom hook

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

body:
Problem When navigating to the Reports page (e.g. from LHB), SearchPage is a god component that handles bulk actions logic within the component even though it doesn't need that logic until a user selects items. Solution Create a `useSearchBulkActions` hook, move all bulk action logic inside the hook. Additionally, create a new component `SearchBulkActionsButton`, conditionally rendering it if any items are selected. `SearchBulkActionsButton` will then call the `useSearchBulkActions` hook to setup the available actions
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @truph01
Upwork Automation - Do Not Edit
  • Upwork Job URL: https://www.upwork.com/jobs/~022026110594833597631
  • Upwork Job ID: 2026110594833597631
  • Last Price Increase: 2026-02-24

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.25-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/79766 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** jsodjsodnjoisjdosij@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Pull Request QA execution **Device used:** Mac 26.2 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Create an expense in self DM. 3. Create an expense in workspace chat. 4. Go to Reports > Expenses. 5. Open the workspace expense. 6. Click More > Merge. 7. Select self DM expense > Continue. 8. Select second option in each section > Next > Merge expenses. → Transaction thread opens. 9. Create an expense in self DM. 10. Create an expense in workspace chat. 11. Go to Reports > Expenses. 12. Select workspace expense via checkbox. 13. Click dropdown button > Merge. 14. Select self DM expense > Continue. 15. Select second option in each section > Next > Merge expenses. ## Expected Result: Transaction thread will open after merging expenses via bulk option (similar to Step 8). ## Actual Result: Self DM opens after merging expenses via bulk option. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aef54d64-c740-4fa5-9d8c-7dbacf9d3857 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.3.24-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** N/A **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** N/A **Issue reported by:** Internal **Slack conversation:** https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C03U7DCU4/p1771522356898249 ## Action Performed: 1. Create a workspace expense. 2. Add multiple attendees to the expense. 3. Split the expense between attendees. 4. View the expense in the NewDot expense table. ## Expected Result: When an expense is split between multiple attendees, the per-person amount should be clearly displayed in the expense table (e.g., “£11.75 per person”), similar to Classic. Additionally, attendees should eventually be represented in a dedicated column (e.g., avatars in an “Attendees” column), while maintaining a clean and consistent table layout aligned with NewDot design principles. ## Actual Result: The expense table only displays the total amount. The per-person split amount is not shown, making it less clear how much each attendee is responsible for and how category limits apply. ## Workaround: Users can open the expense details page to manually calculate or review the split amounts. Expensify can still be used without this being fixed, but clarity is reduced when reviewing split expenses. ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos Proposal from Slack: --- [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Expenses flash yellow highlight repeatedly instead of once

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
r## Bug Description

Slack thread https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1771814813477409

When creating expenses and viewing the Expenses page (Reports > Expenses), newly created expenses flash yellow (highlight animation) correctly on first appearance, but then **flash again repeatedly** on subsequent search result updates. The highlight should only play once per new expense.

## Expected Behavior

Each expense should flash yellow exactly once when it first appears in the Expenses list.

## Actual Behavior

The same expense flashes yellow repeatedly whenever search results are refreshed (e.g., due to Onyx updates, API responses, or other transaction mutations while on the page).

## Root Cause

There is a **race condition** between two cleanup `useEffect`s in `src/hooks/useSearchHighlightAndScroll.ts`, combined with a missing deduplication guard.

### Race condition between Effect A and Effect B

Two effects fire when `newSearchResultKeys` transitions from `null` to a non-null Set:

- **Effect A** (lines 234-258): `requestAnimationFrame` → `setTimeout(300ms)` → clears `transactionIDsToHighlight` in Onyx
- **Effect B** (lines 268-279): `setTimeout(300ms)` → `setNewSearchResultKeys(null)`

**Effect B fires first** (~300ms) because Effect A has an extra `requestAnimationFrame` delay (~16ms). When Effect B fires:

1. `setNewSearchResultKeys(null)` triggers a React re-render
2. Effect A's **cleanup function** runs, calling `clearTimeout(timer)` and `cancelAnimationFrame(animation)` — **this cancels the pending Onyx clear**
3. Effect A re-runs with `newSearchResultKeys === null` and hits the early return at line 236
4. **Result**: `transactionIDsToHighlight` stays `{transactionID: true}` in Onyx permanently (until the user navigates away from the search type)

### Missing deduplication for manual highlights

After the first (correct) highlight, `transactionIDsToHighlight` is never cleared. Then any subsequent change to `searchResults.data` re-fires the "detect new items" effect (line 182). The filter at lines 210-213 **unconditionally returns `true`** for IDs found in `manualHighlightTransactionIDs`, bypassing the `highlightedIDs` deduplication check:

```ts
const newTransactionIDs = currentTransactionIDs.filter((id) => {
    if (manualHighlightTransactionIDs.has(id)) {
        return true;  // <-- Always true, bypasses highlightedIDs check
    }
    // ...
});
```

This causes `newSearchResultKeys` to be set again, and the highlight animation replays. The same cleanup race repeats indefinitely.

## Proposed Fix

**Fix 1 — Eliminate the race condition**: Ensure `transactionIDsToHighlight` is cleared reliably regardless of when `newSearchResultKeys` is reset. For example, clear `transactionIDsToHighlight` immediately when the highlight is consumed in the "detect new items" effect (line 230), rather than in a separate effect with a timer. Alternatively, decouple the two cleanups so Effect A doesn't depend on `newSearchResultKeys` in its dependency array.

**Fix 2 — Add deduplication for manual highlights**: At line 211, also check `highlightedIDs.current.has(id)` before returning `true`:

```ts
if (manualHighlightTransactionIDs.has(id)) {
    return !highlightedIDs.current.has(id);
}
```

## Reproduction Steps

1. Open the Expenses page (Reports > Expenses)
2. Create a new expense using the global create button (e.g., Scan, Manual, Distance)
3. Observe the expense flashes yellow once (correct)
4. Wait for any background data refresh or create another expense
5. Observe the previously created expense flashes yellow again (incorrect)

## Key Files

- `src/hooks/useSearchHighlightAndScroll.ts` — the highlight tracking and cleanup logic
- `src/hooks/useAnimatedHighlightStyle/index.ts` — the yellow flash animation
- `src/libs/actions/IOU/index.ts` (line 1142) — where `transactionIDsToHighlight` is set on expense creation
- `src/libs/actions/Transaction.ts` (line 1545) — `mergeTransactionIdsHighlightOnSearchRoute` Onyx merge function
- `src/components/Search/index.tsx` (lines 1038-1063) — where `shouldAnimateInHighlight` is derived from `newSearchResultKeys`

## Platform

Web, iOS, Android (all platforms using the Expenses search page)

title: [$250] [Performance] Typing in Inbox search freezes JS thread on mobile

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
## Description Typing into the Inbox search (SearchRouter) freezes the JS thread on mobile. The native back gesture and native scrolling still work, but all JS-driven interactions (navigation buttons, virtualization recalculation) become unresponsive. ## Steps to Reproduce 1. Open the app on a mobile device (iOS or Android) 2. Tap the search icon in the Inbox 3. Start typing a search query 4. Observe that the UI becomes unresponsive ## Expected Behavior Search input should remain responsive while filtering results, with no perceptible lag or JS thread blocking. ## Actual Behavior The JS thread freezes. Navigation buttons stop working, virtualization bounds don't recalculate. Only native gestures (back swipe, scroll) continue to work. ## Root Cause `autocompleteQueryValue` in `SearchRouter.tsx` updates immediately on every keystroke (only `textInputValue` is debounced). This triggers synchronous re-computation of: - `getSearchOptions()` -- filters all reports/personal details - `isSearchStringMatch()` -- creates RegExp per word per item - `combineOrderingOfReportsAndPersonalDetails()` -- sorts results - Multiple `.filter()` chains on tags, categories, currencies, participants ## Suggested Fixes 1. Debounce `autocompleteQueryValue` (or the prop passed to `SearchAutocompleteList`) so filtering doesn't run on every keystroke 2. Memoize `searchOptions` and `recentReportsOptions` with stable dependencies 3. Optimize `isSearchStringMatch` -- reuse compiled RegExp objects instead of creating new ones per iteration 4. Consider moving heavy filtering off the JS thread (InteractionManager, web worker, or native module) ## Platform - [x] iOS - [x] Android - [ ] Web (likely affected but less severe) ## Reporter Chuck ([Slack thread](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1771606797669149))
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @aimane-chnaif

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.24-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/71244 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+2250@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 (Hybrid app) - Windows 11 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Account has a workspace with rules enabled. Prerequisite 2: Taxes enabled and at least two taxes different from default one created. 1. Open the Expensify app. 2. Navigate to "Workspaces" > "Rules" > "Add Merchant Rule" 3. In "For expenses with", add any merchant. 4. In "Apply these updates", add a category, a description and a tax rate different from default one. 5. Save the rule. 6. Navigate to workspace chat. 7. Create a manual expense with merchant added on step 3. 8. Open the just created expense. 9. Note that a "Set the category to XX, description to XX and tax rate to XX via workspace rules" system-generated message is displayed on report. 10. Tap on "More" > "Add Expense" > "Create Expense" 11. Create a new manual expense with a different merchant and same "Tax Rate". 12. Select the first created expense. 13. Tap on dropdown menu > "Merge" 14. Select the second created expense. 15. Keep all the details from second expense and finish the merging flow. 16. Once redirected to report, edit the "Tax" field and select another tax different from default one. 17. Note that "Workspace Rules" system generated message appears again. ## Expected Result: "Set the tax to XX via workspace rules" system generated message should not be visible if "Tax" field is edited manually. ## Actual Result: "Set the tax to XX via workspace rules" system generated message, is displayed after merging expenses and editing the tax rate manually. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f4a6e1c9-06bd-42ff-b88e-ac9a6252caed [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
